intro: Ranunculus paludosus var. winkleri, commonly known as the Winkler's marsh buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to wetland habitats in North America. It features delicate, palmately divided leaves and bright yellow flowers with five petals. The plant thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in bogs and marshes. It is characterized by its short, stout stems and is a member of the Ranunculaceae family. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
